statement.p: Atenolol has a half life of 6-7 hours depending on patient factors. For this problem use a half life of 6.7 hours. Suppose Victor is prescribed 75 mg/day. If Victor takes his first 75 mg dose on Monday morning, how much is expected in his blood Tuesday morning at the same time?

solution.p: The half-life model is \displaystyle{A}=\frac{{A}_{{0}}}{{{2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{h}}}}}} where \displaystyle{A}_{{0}} is the initial amount, \displaystyle{t} is the time elapsed, and \displaystyle{h} is the half-life. In this case \displaystyle{A}=\frac{{75}}{{{2}^{{\frac{{24}}{{6.7}}}}}}={6.262458501542}\approx{6.3}.
